str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Probably from the same as Pergamos; a tower; Perga, a place in Asia Minor.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To pass through, spread (as a report). From dia and erchomai; to traverse.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Probably of foreign origin; Pisidia, a region of Asia Minor.
From Antiochus; Antiochia, a place in Syria.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From sunago; an assemblage of persons; specially, a Jewish 'synagogue'; by analogy, a Christian church.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Another form for kathezomai; to seat down, i.e. Set; intransitively, to sit; figuratively, to settle.
